words.definition: Baggage is the set of bags that people take with them when they travel.
words.example: I'm taking several pieces of baggage with me on vacation.

words.definition: A bulb is the glass part of an electric light.
words.example: I had to change the light bulb in my bedroom.

words.definition: A bundle is a number of things that are tied together.
words.example: I was shocked when he showed me a bundle of money.

words.definition: Cattle are cows and bulls, especially on a farm.
words.example: The rancher's cattle were eating the grass in the field.

words.definition: To flee means to run away from trouble or danger.
words.example: The crowd of men tried to flee from the danger.

words.definition: To graze means to eat grass.
words.example: The cows grazed in the field.

words.definition: Greed is a desire to have more than the things that you need.
words.example: She ate all the cookies out of her greed.

words.definition: A herd is a large group of the same type of animals that live together.
words.example: The herd of cows moved slowly across the ranch.

words.definition: To initiate something is to start it.
words.example: The company will initiate a new plan next week.

words.definition: A lane is a small road or path.
words.example: The car drove down the narrow lane.

words.definition: Luggage is the bags and suitcases that you carry when you travel.
words.example: He carried his luggage to the taxi.

words.definition: Nerve is the courage to do something difficult or dangerous.
words.example: It took a lot of nerve to jump off the high board.

words.definition: An optimist is a person who always thinks that good things will happen.
words.example: He is an optimist who always sees the bright side of things.

words.definition: A parade is a celebration where people walk or drive through the streets.
words.example: There was a grand parade for the holiday.

words.definition: To pave a road is to cover it with a hard surface like stone or asphalt.
words.example: They are going to pave the road with stones.

words.definition: A phantom is a ghost or a spirit.
words.example: He thought he saw a phantom in the old house.

words.definition: If something is portable, it is easy to carry or move.
words.example: A laptop is a portable computer.

words.definition: A poster is a large piece of paper with a picture and information on it.
words.example: He put a poster of his favorite band on the wall.

words.definition: To scratch something is to rub it with your fingernails or a sharp object.
words.example: The cat scratched the chair.

words.definition: A symphony is a long piece of music played by an orchestra.
words.example: We went to the concert to hear the symphony.

words.definition: A widow is a woman whose husband is dead.
words.example: The widow lived alone in the house.
